intro: Cheiridopsis spiculata, commonly known as the needleleaf ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its small, spiny leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its hardiness and ornamental appeal, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in dry climates.
